Policy-Relevant Inflation (PCE) Signal

Policy-Relevant Inflation (PCE) Signal

Policy-relevant inflation: composite of headline and core PCE.

As of Unknown

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Policy-Relevant Inflation (PCE) signal indicates a Neutral inflation regime as of 2025-09-30, with the composite z-score at -0.509766 (1). This reflects inflation near its trend, signifying a stable state.
  • Conviction Band: Medium | Interpretation Confidence: High Confidence | Internal Conflict Flag: No

Key Dynamics:

  • The composite reflects an equal-weight average of robust z-scores for headline and core PCE year-over-year inflation (1).
  • Both headline PCE YoY (z-score -0.580884) and core PCE YoY (z-score -0.438648) contribute to the current neutral composite, showing a deceleration from previously "Hot" levels.
  • This suggests stabilisation within the neutral band, with a slight downward drift in underlying z-scores, but remaining firmly above the "Cool" threshold.
  • Conditional Invalidation: A sustained move of the PCE Composite z-score above 0.75 (Hot) or below -0.75 (Cool) would reverse this neutral interpretation (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Inflation maintains a neutral trajectory, with year-over-year PCE growth remaining near its historical trend, aligning with the current composite z-score range (1).
  • Most plausible upside risk: A resurgence in aggregate demand or significant supply-side shocks could push headline and core PCE inflation robust z-scores above 0.75.
  • Most plausible downside risk: A material economic slowdown or disinflationary pressures could cause PCE inflation to cool further, leading to z-scores below -0.75.

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Cyclical (months). The signal relies on monthly year-over-year inflation rates, which typically capture medium-term economic cycles.
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: Medium. This signal provides a robust and policy-relevant gauge of inflation, a critical component for broader macro assessments.

Macro Relevance:

  • Macro dimension informed: Pricing (inflation).
  • Cycle position: The neutral regime suggests a mid-cycle or disinflationary phase where inflation is neither excessively hot nor outright cool (1).
  • Typical interaction with other macro signals: Neutral inflation allows for data-dependent monetary policy (1). It often aligns with stable liquidity and less extreme credit conditions, while influencing real interest rate trends.

Data & References:

  • Personal Consumption Expenditures: Chain-Type Price Index (PCEPI) (Latest: 2025-09-30).
  • Personal Consumption Expenditures Excluding Food and Energy (PCEPILFE) (Latest: 2025-09-30).
  • The PCE_Composite and PCE_Regime values are most influential for the current state.
  • Additional public datasets that would improve depth or reliability: Core CPI YoY, Sticky Price CPI, or the Cleveland Fed's Median CPI would offer complementary perspectives on inflation persistence.
